Cash flow is more important than cash on hand and T is a cash flow machine. Following is the conclusion of a Jan. Wall Street report: Conclusion AT&T does have to deal with access line losses, intense competition, and iPhone subsidies, but the positives greatly outweigh the negatives. These positives include excellent cash flow, steady revenue growth, solid guidance, increased subscribers, U-Verse expansion, and a 5.30 percent yield. The Forward P/E is also just 12.59. AT&T’s stock isn’t likely to be as strong as it has been over the past three years, but it’s still an OUTPERFORM.
Yeah, you did a good hack job on the language, but your point is taken. Where do you get this "short on cash" info from? Maybe I missed this "shortage" business.

Topic.Title: When, where from, and why did your ancestors move to America?

Message.Msg: "Today many arriving here" are very much like those who arrived previously. And they are subject to the same discrimination your immigrant ancestors were subjected to by the decedents of the waves of immigrants that preceded them. Here's what I want you to do. Anytime the words "this time is different" pop into your head, smack yourself and realize that, no, this time is the same. Your immigrant ancestors are no different than the immigrants entering the country today. The direction, the language, the culture, the times may be different, but it is the same. The same immigrant spirit, the same hard work, the same huddled masses yearning to breathe free.

I know you think that, winholder. That's why you believe every email forward that pops up on your screen. That's why wilkes thinks Obama's father was some guy named Frank. That's why the entire conservative blogosphere is going gaga over an obscure article in a magazine that used to be the mouthpiece of an dictator. That's why, in essence, you are idiots. I know exactly what you morons think and why you think it.
Wilkes, we've been over this before. Whether you think Barack Obama Sr. is Barack Obama Jr.'s father or not, he was an economist from Kenya.

Message.Msg: "One big difference is that at some time in the past we actually had control of our borders" No we didn't. Just ask Pancho Villa. "there is little assimilation into our society and more of a 'separate but equal' standard " Utter BS. You're comparing immigration to legally enforced segregation because immigrants don't turn into the Cleavers overnight? Ever heard of Chinatown? Little Italy? You just have no sense of reality or perspective. None.
